graph_title: Neonatal mortality rate - modified and reported by county

graph_titles.title: Percentage of infant deaths with preterm births by state

indicator_name: Neonatal mortality rate - modified and reported by county
SDG_GOAL: Goal 3: Ensure healthy lives and promote well-being for all at all ages
SDG_TARGET: Target 3.2: By 2030, end preventable deaths of newborns and children under 5 years of age,  with all countries aiming to reduce neonatal mortality to at least as low as 12 per 1,000  live births and under‐5 mortality to at least as low as 25 per 1,000 live births
SDG_INDICATOR: Indicator 3.2.2: Neonatal mortality rate - modified and reported by county
STAT_CONC_DEF:
## Definition:
NEONATAL MORTALITY RATE is the number of resident newborns in a specified geographic area (country, state, county, etc.) dying at less than 28 days of age divided by the number of resident live births for the same geographic area (for a specified time period, usually a calendar year) and multiplied by 1,000.
  
## Limitations:
The neonatal mortality rate is not reported at the city level and is reported at the county level as infant deaths with preterm births.
